synthesis_analysis: The AI excels at validating feelings and providing structured, practical steps, building trust effectively. Its main weakness is applying a one-size-fits-all approach to anxiety, often escalating it by suggesting self-conscious techniques like recording or eye contact. To improve, it must first differentiate support for high-anxiety students (prioritizing internal calming and tiny steps) from low-anxiety ones (leveraging their strengths). The priority for evolution is integrating adaptive, anxiety-aware strategies to prevent escalating distress.
